meanings.definition: A fine-grained metamorphic rock formed by the crushing and shearing of rocks along a fault zone.
meanings.sent1: The geologist found a piece of mylonite near the fault line.
meanings.sent2: Miners discovered a vein of mylonite while excavating the area.
meanings.sent3: The mylonite looked like a puzzle of crushed rocks put back together.
meanings.sent4: The mylonite resembled a mosaic of shattered stones.
meanings.sent5: The mylonite sparkled in the sunlight, revealing its crushed origins.
